This is an extraordinary story of extraordinary herorism. The fact is that certain things the world take for granted once constituted a monumental and near-insurmountable challenge. Today, people live in the South Pole or polar extremeties of the world. It's very impressive, interesting and commendable that Charles Moore delivered this centennial, commemorative article.
But, a century ago, it was almost an impossible dream as some members of the British polar expedition faced incredible odds to get to the South Pole and got fatally hammered by the Cold blizzard.
The story of Captain Lawrence Oates is a great one. Captain Robert Falcon Scott was the more recognizable of the heroic crew of the ill-fated expedition. This wss a major fatalistic tragedy a century ago.
The year 1912 was one defined by the ill-fated South Pole expedition, and, of course the Titanic, almost a month later. It's commendable to commemorate the South Pole expedition a century later. Igonikon Jack, USA
